row.entry: This panel lets you use a powerful functionality of darktable: to store and apply a history stack. Styles are created in darkroom mode thanks to a button placed below the history stack. Then they are managed within this panel, that allows you to apply and delete a style.

sect4.title: create duplicate
sect4.para: When applying a style on selected images, activating this box lets you create a duplicate before applying the styles. De-activate this option if you want to try various styles; this will avoid that you create multiple duplicates.

sect4.title: edit
sect4.para: Styles are a collection of history stack items. After pressing edit you are prompted with a dialog in which you can deselect specific items. Check option "duplicate" if you want to create a new style instead of overwriting the existing one; you need to give a new style name in this case.

sect4.title: delete
sect4.para: This will delete the selected style without further question.

sect4.title: import
sect4.para: You can import a style which has been previously saved by darktable. Darktable stores its files in xml files with the extension .dtstyle.

sect4.title: export
sect4.para: This option saves a selected style to disk as a .dtstyle file. This allows to share styles among users.
